Jinnō Shōtōki, p. 164. ==Change of era== * February 6, 824 : The new era name was created to mark an event or series of events. The previous era ended and the new one commenced in Kōnin 15, on the 5th day of the 1st month of 824.Brown, p. 282. ==Events of the Tenchō era== * 824 (Tenchō 1): This summer was entirely dry; and prayers for rain were offered by the Buddhist priest Kūkai, who is also known by the posthumous name, Kōbō-Daishi. Those prayers seemed to be answered when it did begin to rain sometime later.Titsingh, p. 103. * 824 (Tenchō 1, 7th month): The former-Emperor Heizei died at age 51. * 825 (Tenchō 2, 11th month): The former-Emperor Saga celebrated his 40th birthday.Titsingh, p. 104. * 826 (Tenchō 3, 11th month): Kōbō-Daishi counsels the emperor to build a pagoda near To-ji in Kyoto.Titsingh, p. 105. ==Notes== ==References== * Brown, Delmer M. and Ichirō Ishida, eds.
